definition: To enter or step into a place, often used to describe physically moving into a building, room, or enclosed area. It can also refer to joining or becoming a member of a group, organization, or cause.

examples.german: Ich trete in den Raum ein.
Sie tritt in die Fußstapfen ihres Vaters ein.
examples.english: She follows in her father's footsteps.

examples.german: Der Verein tritt der Liga bei.
Er tritt in die Partei ein.
Die Tür tritt nach innen ein.
